business.headline: Sensex, Nifty extend gains as GST cut optimism fuels Dalal Street rallyThe S&P BSE Sensex gained nearly 300 points in early trade, while the Nifty50 climbed past 24,800, signalling the possibility of a fresh rally if a favourable outcome emerges on the US tariff front.

Oracle, Salesforce cut hundreds of jobs in US as tech layoffs drag on: ReportIn filings with state regulators, the two software giants disclosed plans to eliminate more than 500 jobs in the Bay Area and nearly 200 in the Seattle region. Salesforce is cutting 262 roles in San Francisco, while Oracle is eliminating 254 jobs spread across Redwood City, Pleasanton and Santa Clara.
How will you invest in US? Trump presses tech titans at White House dinnerAt a White House dinner with top tech CEOs, Donald Trump pressed Apple, Google, Meta, and Microsoft on their US investments.

What after Armani: The way ahead for iconic Italian fashion empireGiorgio Armani, who died at 91 leaving no children, built one of the world's most iconic fashion brands and ensured its future independence through a foundation.

US scraps Biden-era plan mandating airlines to pay for flight disruptionsIn December, the US Department of Transportation under then-President Joe Biden sought public comment on the rulemaking process about whether airlines should be required to pay $200 to $300 for domestic delays of at least three hours and up to $775 for longer delays.

GST reforms: Will consumption and investment get a real boost? Experts debateA major overhaul of the Goods and Services Tax, termed GST 2.0, has been initiated, which the government is calling a significant 'Diwali bonus' for consumers and the economy.

GST 2.0 is game-changing and transformational reform: Piyush GoyalIn an exclusive interview with India Today TV's Managing Editor Marya Shakil, Union Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal called GST 2.0 the most game-changing and transformational reform the country has seen in several decades.

GST 2.0 a game-changing reform for citizens and businesses: Piyush GoyalUnion Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal has described the new GST 2.0 reforms as a "game-changing" move that will simplify taxes, reduce prices on daily essentials, and give a major boost to India's economy.

Zara, Lacoste, and other global brands face higher GST: ReportInternational names such as Zara, H&M, Levi's, Lacoste, Nike and Uniqlo could be directly impacted. These brands rely heavily on India's growing middle-class youth, who see branded apparel as a lifestyle upgrade but remain highly price-sensitive.

GST reforms commendable, will have far-reaching benefits: Anand SharmaIn an exclusive interview with India Today TV, former Commerce Minister Anand Sharma provides his assessment of the next-generation GST reforms.

Sensex, Nifty end higher: Is GST 2.0 next big trigger for the economy?Speaking on the possible impact on the market closing show on BT TV, Vinit Bolinjkar, Head of Research at Ventura Securities, said the domestic economy is set for a strong rebound.

What are 'sin' goods? All you need to know about special 40% GST slabFrom September 22, 2025, India will have a simpler GST system with just two main rates and a special 40% slab. This top rate applies only to a few products, popularly known as 'sin goods'. Let's break it down.

entertainment.headline: Vivek Agnihotri alleges theatres in Bengal threatened against screening The Bengal FilesFilmmaker Vivek Agnihotri recently shared that his film 'The Bengal Files' cannot be released in West Bengal, and is seeking legal recourse for it.

Hrithik emotional after watching Saba in Songs of Paradise, recalls her strugglesHrithik Roshan was moved by girlfriend Saba Azad's performance in 'Songs of Paradise.' In his heartfelt note, the actor praised her acting and recalled her struggles.

STR 49: Silambarasan steps into Vetri Maaran's Vada Chennai universeThe official glimpse of Vetri Maaran's 'STR 49', starring Silambarasan TR, has been unveiled, promising a gripping new chapter in the 'Vada Chennai' universe.

Baaghi 4 certified A after CBFC cuts violence and adult scenesTiger Shroff's Baaghi 4 receives an A certificate after multiple CBFC cuts for violence and adult content. The film's runtime was shortened voluntarily, highlighting increasing censorship challenges in Bollywood.

Dulquer Salmaan crowns Naslen 'superstar', fans say the prophecy has begunDulquer Salmaan's "superstar" comment about Naslen shows his quick rise in Malayalam cinema. His recent film 'Lokah: Chapter 1' is currently ruling theatres.

Top films and series releasing on Prime Video this weekendRajkummar Rao's 'Maalik' and Vishnu Manchu's 'Kannappa' start streaming on the OTT platform this weekend. Tilly Ramsay's cooking show 'Dish It Out' comes out, and so does K Drama 'Confidence Queen'. Have is a look at the complete list of the latest Prime Video releases.

Singer Karan Aujla confirms performance on The Tonight Show with Jimmy FallonSinger Karan Aujla will perform on 'The Tonight Show with Jimmy Fallon' this Tuesday. Aujla will be the second Paunjabi singer to appear on the show after Diljit Dosanjh.

Archana Puran Singh's son Aaryamann and Yogita Bihani move in togetherAaryamann Sethi and his fiancee Yogita Bihani have moved in together to a house gifted by Archana Puran Singh and her husband Parmeet Sethi. The couple documented the process of moving in a vlog shared on Aaryamann's YouTube channel.

Majnu Bhai supremacy: Vijay Varma brings home Anil Kapoor's iconic Welcome paintingVijay Varma thrilled Bollywood fans by posing with the iconic Majnu Bhai painting from 'Welcome', reviving a beloved slice of cinematic humour that still brings joy years after its debut.

Punjab floods: Bollywood and Punjabi stars unite for relief effortsBollywood and Punjabi celebrities have stepped up to support flood-affected Punjab with monetary aid and relief efforts. Sonu Sood, Randeep Hooda, and Kapil Sharma extended their help.

Actor Sivakarthikeyan on Madharaasi: It's a Murugadoss film and I am in itAfter the blockbuster success of 'Amaran', Sivakarthikeyan has taken on a new challenge with 'Madharaasi', an action thriller directed by AR Murugadoss. In an interview with India Today, he discussed 'Madharaasi', doing action films, Tamil cinema's quest for a Rs 1000 crore-film and the satisfaction he receives as a producer.

You actor Penn Badgley welcomes identical twin boys with wife Domino KirkeAmerican actor Penn Badgley and wife Domino Kirke have welcomed identical twin sons. The couple shares emotional moments from the pregnancy and reflects on raising twins in today's world.

The Return of Sonu Nigam and the voice Bollywood forgotSonu Nigam makes a powerful return to Bollywood, reviving the magic of melody that the industry has been missing for years. With 'Bijuria' and 'Pardesiya' striking gold, one thing is clear: Nigam is and will always be irreplaceable.

Coolie on OTT: When and where to watch Rajinikanth-Lokesh Kanagaraj's Tamil actionerAfter a spectacular theatrical run, Rajinikanth and Lokesh Kanagaraj's 'Coolie' is set for its OTT streaming. The Tamil film, also starring Nagarjuna, Shruti Haasan, and others, will release on Prime Video.

Will Taylor Swift perform at Super Bowl halftime? NFL commissioner respondsNFL commissioner Roger Goodell suggested Taylor Swift's Super Bowl halftime show appearance was "a maybe", heightening anticipation as fans await word from Roc Nation.

Travis Kelce on introducing Taylor Swift as fiancee to colleagues: Pretty coolTravis Kelce recently introduced Taylor Swift as his fiancee to his colleagues. He shared the moment on the 'New Heights' podcast. The player also expressed gratitude for the overwhelming love from fans.

The Paper, The Office spin-off, renewed for Season 2 ahead of September 5 premierePeacock's new sitcom 'The Paper' has been renewed for a second season even before its first episode airs. Featuring a talented cast and veteran creators, the series will begin to stream from September 5.

No objectionable content: Court rejects plea against Akshay Kumar's Jolly LLB 3The Allahabad High Court recently dismissed the plea against Akshay Kumar's 'Jolly LLB 3'. The film is slated to hit the big screens on September 19.

Bigg Boss 19 episode 10: Pranit loses captaincy access after taking dig at ZeishanPranit More's stand-up comedy act in the latest episode of 'Bigg Boss 19' irked Zeeshan Quadri and Tanya Mittal. Housemates later voted in favour of Zeishan Quadri and eliminated Pranit More from the race for captaincy.

general news.headline: It's gone now: Ex-US NSA John Bolton says Trump-Modi friendship is historyJohn Bolton says Trump's once-strong personal relationship with Modi is "gone now," warning leaders like UK's Keir Starmer that personal ties with Trump offer no real protection from his unpredictable policies.

India must play key role in ending Ukraine war, PM told on call with EU leadersPM Modi held a joint call with EU leaders, discussed trade, security, and Ukraine, invited them to India for the next summit, and reaffirmed his commitment to strengthen the India-EU strategic partnership.

Trump hosts powerful tech CEOs for White House dinner; Elon Musk not invitedPresident Donald Trump hosted tech leaders, including Gates, Cook, Zuckerberg and Pichai for a White House dinner, with AI policy in focus. Elon Musk, once an ally, was notably absent.

Row erupts over 'Halal lifestyle township' project near MumbaiA promotional video for a housing project near Mumbai has sparked a row, with political parties alleging it promotes exclusivity on religious lines.

Why pizza orders were tracked amid Trump is Dead buzzEarlier this week, when speculation over Donald Trump's alleged death was swirling, the Pentagon Pizza Index surged by 800%. Pizza orders near the Pentagon—the headquarters of the US Defence Department—are considered a barometer, hinting at officials at work for hours, during a crunch situation. This was also the case in June when the US bombed Iran. Even Soviet spies kept an eye on pizza orders during the Cold War.

Semi-finals Live Updates: Osaka vs Anisimova heads to decider, Sabalenka in finalUS Open 2025, semi-finals Live Updates: Naomi Osaka misses an opportunity to close the semifinal in straight sets. Amanda Anisimova bounce back to force a decider as it's past the midnight in New York. Earlier in the day, Aryna Sabalenka progressed to the final after outlasting Jessica Pegula in a three-set marathon.

How dare you? Video of Ajit Pawar rebuking woman IPS officer goes viralIn the viral video, Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar was heard telling IPS officer Anjana Krishna to halt the police crackdown on illegal murrum excavation in Maharashtra's Solapur.

Oracle, Salesforce cut hundreds of jobs in US as tech layoffs drag on: ReportIn filings with state regulators, the two software giants disclosed plans to eliminate more than 500 jobs in the Bay Area and nearly 200 in the Seattle region. Salesforce is cutting 262 roles in San Francisco, while Oracle is eliminating 254 jobs spread across Redwood City, Pleasanton and Santa Clara.
How rainy-day traffic broke Gurugram's urban prideThe September 1 snarl is a reminder of the perils of big cities built without holistically addressing the ecological aspects of habitation.

Student, 20, found dead at BITS Pilani Goa campus, 5th such case in 10 monthsA 20-year-old student was found dead in his hostel room at BITS Pilani campus in Goa. This is the fifth such incident since December last year.

Messi scores twice in Argentina's 3-0 win in emotional home farewellLionel Messi struck twice as Argentina defeated Venezuela 3-0 on Thursday in what marked the eight-time Ballon d'Or winner's final World Cup qualifier on home soil.
How will you invest in US? Trump presses tech titans at White House dinnerAt a White House dinner with top tech CEOs, Donald Trump pressed Apple, Google, Meta, and Microsoft on their US investments.

Vivek Agnihotri alleges theatres in Bengal threatened against screening The Bengal FilesFilmmaker Vivek Agnihotri recently shared that his film 'The Bengal Files' cannot be released in West Bengal, and is seeking legal recourse for it.

What after Armani: The way ahead for iconic Italian fashion empireGiorgio Armani, who died at 91 leaving no children, built one of the world's most iconic fashion brands and ensured its future independence through a foundation.

Asia Cup 2025: How India can reach the final in Rajgir? Scenarios explainedThe Super 4s stage is wide open, but India holds the advantage over the rest following their 4-1 win against Malaysia on Thursday, September 4. Here's what all four teams need to make it to the final of the Asia Cup on Sunday.

GST overhaul a good step but not sufficient to boost economy, says ChidambaramIn an interview with India Today TV, former Union Finance Minister P Chidambaram on Thursday described the recent GST overhaul as a "necessary step, but not a sufficient step" to boost the nation's economy.

Meet 7 Indian teachers quietly changing the country's classroomsEducation is not just about exams or grades — it is the real measure of how our future will unfold.  On Teacher's Day, here are seven Indian teachers who have transformed classrooms with simple yet powerful ideas -- from QR codes and wall blackboards to feminist pedagogy -- changing the lives of millions of students across villages and towns. They deserve to become household names.

Siddaramaiah, his family given clean chit in Muda 'scam', panel blames officialsThe PN Desai Commission has given a clean chit to Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah and his family in the Muda site allotment case, with the cabinet accepting its report and recommending action against officials.

Inside story of GST meet: States' resistance, vote call, and then a breakthroughRelief for the middle class and poor was at stake as the GST Council meeting stretched past 7 pm on Wednesday. With opposition-ruled states resisting tax reforms, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman insisted that the people could not be kept waiting another day.

Little feet, big journeys: Your complete guide to travelling with a babyTravelling with a baby does feel overwhelming, no matter if it's your first time or your hundredth. But with the right tips and preparation, you can navigate every journey with ease and confidence.

Sugar is sin: Why India's new GST reform hits your cola harder than cigarettesFor the first time, sugary drinks like colas, iced teas, and energy drinks face a steep 40% GST, alongside tobacco and alcohol. Here's why sugar is India's newest "sin" and what it means for your health.

Dawood's archrival Arun Gawli is back in Byculla ahead of BMC pollsDon Arun Gawli's return to Byculla after an 18-year prison stint has stirred political chatter ahead of the BMC election. Gawli, who is still believed to be influential, might impact voting in the Dagdi Chawl area. Gawli, who rose from a mill worker to a gangster and became an MLA, has been let off on bail during the Ganesh Mahotsav.

Rajasthan man kills cousin over 'affair with wife', buries body with own excavatorAccording to police, Sohanram killed his cousin Mukesh over suspicion of an affair with his wife. Mukesh's body was recovered from a 10-foot-deep pit in Sohanram's mine.

Nearly 47 per cent of India's ministers face criminal charges: ReportThe report came days after the Centre introduced three bills that sought the removal of prime minister, chief ministers, and ministers arrested or detained for 30 consecutive days.

sports.headline: Lionel Messi remains coy on Argentina future: I haven't decided about World CupLionel Messi said he has not yet decided if he will play at the 2026 World Cup after scoring twice in Argentina's 3-0 win over Venezuela in Buenos Aires, his last World Cup qualifier at home.

Suryakumar, Hardik join coach Gambhir as India squad arrives in DubaiAsia Cup 2025: India players and head coach Gautam Gambhir arrived in Dubai on Thursday evening. The team will hold its first training session on Friday, five days before their tournament opener against the UAE.

Ross Taylor ends retirement to play for Samoa: NZ great's decision explainedRoss Taylor has reversed his retirement to represent Samoa in the 2026 T20 World Cup qualifier. The 41-year-old said he is still fit enough to run around and is keen on boosting the profile of cricket in Samoa.

Daniel Levy steps down as Tottenham Hotspur chairman after divisive 25-year tenureDaniel Levy has stepped down as Tottenham Hotspur chairman, the club announced on Thursday, bringing an end to a nearly 25-year tenure marked by financial stability but a lack of major silverware.

Molineux set to make return as Australia name squad for Women's ODI World CupSophie Molineux has been named in Australia's 15-player squad for the ODI World Cup in India and Sri Lanka and is expected to be fit in time. Leg-spinner Georgia Wareham has also recovered from the injury that cut short her Hundred campaign.

Breetzke sets ODI world record to help South Africa clinch series win vs EnglandSouth Africa's Matthew Breetzke became the first player to score half-centuries in each of his first five ODI appearances, setting up his side's gripping, series-clinching five-run victory over England at Lord's on Thursday.

Sabalenka battles past Jessica Pegula to keep US Open title defence aliveWorld No. 1 Aryna Sabalenka kept her US Open title defence alive on Thursday, rallying to beat American Jessica Pegula 4-6, 6-3, 6-4 in their semi-final clash. The Belarusian recovered from a shaky opening set in a rematch of last year's final, silencing the partisan Arthur Ashe Stadium crowd before overpowering the fourth seed with 43 winners and eight aces.

Asia Cup 2025: How India can reach the final in Rajgir? Scenarios explainedThe Super 4s stage is wide open, but India holds the advantage over the rest following their 4-1 win against Malaysia on Thursday, September 4. Here's what all four teams need to make it to the final of the Asia Cup on Sunday.

Messi scores twice in Argentina's 3-0 win in emotional home farewellLionel Messi struck twice as Argentina defeated Venezuela 3-0 on Thursday in what marked the eight-time Ballon d'Or winner's final World Cup qualifier on home soil.

US Open: Yuki Bhambri's dream run ends with semifinal loss in men's doublesUS Open 2025: India's Yuki Bhambri and his KIwi partner Michael Venus were knocked out in the men's doubles semi-final after a three-set battle against higher-ranked Joe Salisbury and Neil Skupski.

Semi-finals Live Updates: Osaka in control vs Anisimova, Sabalenka reaches finalUS Open 2025, semi-finals Live Updates: Naomi Osaka is in action against Amanda Anisimova. Aryna Sabalenka reaches third US Open final. Yuki Bhambri knocked out of the men's doubles semi-final match.

Sabalenka battles past Jessica Pegula to keep US Open title defence aliveWorld No. 1 Aryna Sabalenka kept her US Open title defence alive on Thursday, rallying to beat American Jessica Pegula 4-6, 6-3, 6-4 in their semi-final clash. The Belarusian recovered from a shaky opening set in a rematch of last year's final, silencing the partisan Arthur Ashe Stadium crowd before overpowering the fourth seed with 43 winners and eight aces.

Scenarios explainedThe Super 4s stage is wide open, but India holds the advantage over the rest following their 4-1 win against Malaysia on Thursday, September 4. Here's what all four teams need to make it to the final of the Asia Cup on Sunday.

US Open: Yuki Bhambri's dream run ends with semifinal loss in men's doublesUS Open 2025: India's Yuki Bhambri and his KIwi partner Michael Venus were knocked out in the men's doubles semi-final after a three-set battle against higher-ranked Joe Salisbury and Neil Skupski.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
